com.vicinityconcepts.lib.util

Class Worker

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.vicinityconcepts.lib.util.Service
      • com.vicinityconcepts.lib.util.Worker
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Procedure

    public class Worker
extends Service
    A worker is a service that picks up and executes jobs using a queue.
    Author:
    Ryan Palmer

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private Job current
      The current job that has been picked up from the queue.
      private static java.lang.String FINISHED_JOB 
      private static java.lang.String KILLED_JOB 
      private java.util.concurrent.ConcurrentLinkedQueue<Job> queue
      Jobs will be picked up from this queue for execution.
      private static java.lang.String STARTED_JOB
      Constants

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructor and Description
      Worker()

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void assign(Job job)
      Adds a job to this worker's queue.
      private void clearCurrentJob()
      Clears the current job.
      int getQueueSize()
      Get the number of jobs in this worker's queue.
      void kill()
      Shut down this worker, stopping the current job.
      private void killCurrentJob()
      Kill the current job if one exists.
      private boolean pickUpNewJob()
      Take the next job out of the queue.
      protected void run()
      This logic runs repeatedly until the worker is stopped.
      private void waitForQueueActivity()
      Suspend thread execution until a new job has been queued.

    • Method Detail

      • run

        protected void run()
        This logic runs repeatedly until the worker is stopped.
        Specified by:
        run in class Service

      • kill

        public void kill()
        Shut down this worker, stopping the current job.

      • assign

        public void assign(Job job)
        Adds a job to this worker's queue. Queued jobs are picked up and executed in the order in which they were received.
        Parameters:
        job - The job to add to the queue

      • pickUpNewJob

        private boolean pickUpNewJob()
        Take the next job out of the queue. Synchronized to ensure thread safety of the current job object.
        Returns:
        true if a job was picked up, false if not

      • clearCurrentJob

        private void clearCurrentJob()
        Clears the current job. Synchronized to ensure thread safety of the current job object.

      • killCurrentJob

        private void killCurrentJob()
        Kill the current job if one exists. Synchronized to ensure thread safety of the current job object.

      • waitForQueueActivity

        private void waitForQueueActivity()
        Suspend thread execution until a new job has been queued.

      • getQueueSize

        public int getQueueSize()
        Get the number of jobs in this worker's queue.
